For part of said coursework I had to programmatically detect beats in music.

  • I didn‚Äôt need a high level of detail detail, so did the analysis mostly on the fly using a Fast Fourier Transform. These transforms allow working with complex signal-based data (like music) in the far simpler frequency domain. For every playable moment of the song, you get amplitudes as numbers. (Observable<Array<Array<Number>>>)
  • Averaging these numbers gives the current ‚Äúenergy‚Äù of the song. Storing that in a buffer lets you track ‚Äúenergy‚Äù over time. By counting when the "energy" jumps, you find beats! There‚Äôs a bit more to it, and loads of nuance in tuning all explained in this great article on gamedev.
